properties.description: Boston ivy covers the building, setting the café apart from the bustle of the city. There's not only coffee available, but also tacos and pizza. It's a comfortable place where you should slow down and relax.

item1.description: Cold whole or oat milk drink with flavored syrup. No coffee! Enjoy with a classic chai or vanilla syrup, or ask our baristas about our seasonal syrup options.
item1.name: Iced Steamer

item2.description: Enjoy your chewy shrimp with sour salsa, but the original taste is awesome as well.
item2.name: Shrimp Taco

properties.title: Big Bear Cafe

properties.description: The Penn Quarter store, a branch of Teaism, is located on the corner of 8th and D Streets NW. It's visible from the Archives/Navy Memorial metro stop and is part of a set of DC-based teahouses and Asian-inspired restaurants.

item1.description: Hot Chai Indian spices with milk & sugar
item1.name: Chai

properties.title: Teaism Penn Quarter

properties.description: Step into a lively ambiance at Jane Jane. The chic counter clerk immediately evokes memories of San Francisco. Jane Jane located in the heart of 14th Street NW. This cocktail bar is perfect for drinks pre or post dinner drinks, complemented by its well-balanced yet unobtrusive drunk food.

item1.description: Caramelized Onions, Cream Cheese, Sour Cream, Mayonnaise, Spices
item1.name: Onion Dip

item2.description: Pisco, Aperol, Maraschino Liqueur, Grapefruit Juice, Lemon Juice, Simple Syrup
item2.name: Cusco

item3.description: Scotch, Irish Whiskey, Orgeat, Lemon Juice
item3.name: Cameron's Kick

item4.description: Gin, Benedictine, Cointreau, Heering Cherry Liqueur, Pineapple Juice, Lime Juice, Angostura, Soda Water
item4.name: Singapore Sling

properties.title: Jane Jane

properties.description: A cozy restaurant is situated on 14th Street, offering delicious Thai cuisine; its Japanese fare is also commendable. Upon entering the restaurant, don't miss the Rice Market—simply head downstairs to the basement of the same building. It offers a variety of Asian seasonings and ingredients, along with Japanese kitchenware and tableware.

item2.description: Fire Fly Vodka, Sour mix, Lime juice.
item2.name: Sweet Tea Lemonade

properties.title: Rice Restaurant

properties.description: Located at the corner of 77th Street on the Upper East Side, this restaurant offers generous portions that allow you to sample various dishes in one sitting. The slightly strong seasoning is enough to evoke memories of your travels in Southeast Asia. The only downside is that during peak hours, the busy kitchen may serve you slightly overcooked octopus tentacles.

item1.description: Grilled octopus tentacle, grape tomato, chickpea, cilantro, mint, basil, fried onion.
item1.name: Muk Yarng

item2.description:
Choose either chicken, shrimp, vegetables, or tofu. This light and spicy tom yum broth simmered with galangal, lemongrass, onions, mushrooms, scallions and cilantro.
$8(S)/$15(L)
item2.name: Tom Yum

item4.description: Don Fulano Reposado Tequila, Domaine de Canton, watermelon juice, Tanjin spicy rim.
item4.name: What-a-melon

properties.title: THEP Thai Restaurant

properties.description: It was established in February 1864 by the Union military commander of the Alexandria District for use as a cemetery for the burial of African Americans who had escaped slavery, known as contrabands and freedmen.
properties.title: Contrabands and Freedmen Cemetery Memorial

properties.address: One Ferry Building, The Embarcadero S, San Francisco, CA 94111, United States
properties.description: Gott's Roadside, established by brothers Joel and Duncan Gott in St. Helena in 1999, offers a diverse menu that includes meals, tacos, beer, and ice cream. It is celebrated for its contemporary California-inspired dishes, crafted with locally sourced ingredients. The store is situated on the left side of the Ferry Building, featuring a roadside restaurant and a walk-through ice cream store inside.

item1.description: The California flavor hamburger with below ingredients: Fried egg, Cowgirl Creamery's Wagon Wheel cheese, Zoe's bacon, arugula, balsamic onions & mayo on a toasted sesame brioche bun.
item1.name: California Burger

properties.title: Gott's Roadside

properties.address: 201 Castro St, Mountain View, CA 94041, United States
properties.description: The coffee shop, located in Silicon Valley and featuring a two-floor space, recently became the venue for an interview with Y-Combinator CEO Garry Tan by Bloomberg.

item2.description: The croissant filled with ham and cheese. Feel free to ask the staff to heat it up for you.
item2.name: Ham & Cheese Croissant

properties.title: Red Rock Coffee

properties.description: This is a Rum bar that offers a variety of Rums and Spanish cuisine. The staff is passionate about introducing their products.

item2.description:
Region: Belize and Australia, 69.4% ABV
Cyberpunk series from French bottler Zn09 Zero Nine Spirits. Selected with passion by Grégory and Alain, this Belize rum, aged for 12 years in the tropics, is an invitation to discovery.
item2.name: Zn09 Cyberpunk Series Rh02 Belize 2007

item3.description:
Region: Martinique, 60,8° ABV
A 100% pure cane juice rum from the French West Indies, aged for 5 years in bourbon barrels (3 years on site and 2 years in Europe).
item3.name: Zn09 So Rum Rh07 Pure Juice Cask Strength

properties.title: Ole Rum Bar & Tapas

properties.address: No. 4, Lane 23, Section 2, Anhe Rd, Da’an District, Taipei City, Taiwan 106
properties.description: A professional whiskey bar, where bartenders possess a wealth of knowledge about whiskey and offer friendly service, is designed to help you find the whiskey that best suits your taste.

item1.description:
Region: Cuba, 45° ABV
A 1998 vintage Cuban rum from an unnamed distillery. It is not stated which of the distilleries or stills this rum came from, but American oak cask #8 was bottled in Scotland.
item1.name: Cuba Rum 1998 Samaroli Single Cask #8

item2.description: The cocktail is made by a waiter who will follow your mood and tastes.

properties.description: A taco restaurant operated by a Taiwanese sous chef from ZEA, with his unique understanding of Mexican food. It offers corn-based tacos in a clean environment, albeit at a slightly higher price than regular taco restaurants.

Chorizo, Pollo asado and Baja fish.
Add any drinks +NT$90

The staff is friendly and eager to introduce the dishes, and they enjoy chatting with customers. The tacos and sauce boast authentic Mexican flavors.
